name: Summer Squash and Sausage Stew
author: Chef John
summary: This simple squash and sausage stew represents my idea of the perfect summer supper. It's very comforting, relatively fast, wonderfully flavorful, and helps solve a problem that's existed since neighbors started planting gardens: what to do with all that squash! Serve it with a big slice of crusty bread for dipping into the broth.
ingredients: 3 cups chicken broth, or as needed
1 cup crushed tomatoes, such as San Marzano
½ cup diced jalapeno chile pepper
2 pounds assorted summer squash, such as zucchini or yellow crookneck - trimmed and cut into chunks
1 ½ pounds Yukon Gold potatoes, peeled and quartered  (Optional)
salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
1 pinch cayenne pepper, or to taste
2 teaspoons freshly shredded Parmesan cheese, or to taste
directions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium-high heat; cook sausage slices until they begin to brown, 3 to 4 minutes
Add onion, reduce heat to medium, and cook until onion becomes translucent, about 5 minutes
Stir in garlic and cook until fragrant, 30 seconds to 1 minute
Add chicken broth, crushed tomatoes, and jalapeno pepper; stir to combine
Bring mixture to a simmer; gently stir squash and potatoes into mixture
Season with salt, black pepper, and cayenne pepper
Simmer stew, uncovered, until potatoes and squash are tender, 30 to 35 minutes
Adjust levels of salt, black pepper, and cayenne pepper if needed
Serve in bowls; sprinkle with Parmesan cheese
